title: Making incorporation easy
desc: LegalZoom is a disruptive online startup, providing legal services including Limited Liability Company (LLC) creation. User research—led by LegalZoomâ€™s R&D department—uncovered deficiencies in their LLC landing page. The following proposal sought to communicate key benefits more succinctly and encourage Express Gold subscriptions, among other KPIs.

title: Building a community
desc: IBM required a central platform for sharing their Storage division activities with Business Partners. It was aptly named Storage Zone and attributed a bold, vibrant identity. A componentised UI library was developed specifically for the platform, leveraging the IBM Design Language to ensure experiential continuity with other IBM products.

title: Accelerating life sciences
desc: As part of a strategic focus on high-performance computing, this HPE and NVIDIA campaign was directed at scientists with outdated simulation hardware. Display advertising was used across LinkedIn and ResearchGate, with these touchpoints leading to a microsite that captured data from gated content.

title: Distilling a brand
role: Brand Strategy, Visual Identity, Catalogue Design, UI/UX
desc: First established in 1922, Hillbrush is a cleaning tool manufacturer, now exporting to over 95 countries worldwide. The outcome of a strategic rebrand was a robust identity system, using monolithic brand architecture to gel a diverse portfolio. Immediate results were simpler product navigation across eCommerce, a 63% reduction in catalogue length and a clear relationship between previously abstract brands.

title: Humanising resources
desc: Lexonis is a HR software house focused on competency management. After refreshing their identity, Lexonis required support with brand implementation, including a series of product leaflets and email communications.

title: Painting a typeface
desc: Nieuwe Beelding was a self-initiated type design project inspired by painter Piet Mondrian. The typeface is geometric, adopting the strict visual language of Nieuwe Beelding (translated as Neoplasticism). Five weights were produced, ranging from Thin to Black, and presented using a foldout specimen booklet and range of creative posters. A microsite was later developed as a point of sale, allowing users to trial custom content in Nieuwe Beelding.
